content: MCP Mesh: Framework for building distributed MCP agents with automatic service discovery and dependency injection. Key commands: `meshctl start` (run agent), `meshctl list` (list running agents), `meshctl call` (invoke tool on agent), `meshctl scaffold` (generate agent from template/LLM), `meshctl status` (service status), `meshctl man` (manual pages). Core concepts: Registry (central coordination, stores capabilities, resolves dependencies), Agents (Python services with @mesh.agent decorator), Capabilities (named services agents provide), Dependencies (auto-injected at runtime). Agents communicate directly via MCP - registry facilitates discovery but never proxies calls. Uses dual-heartbeat system (HEAD every ~5s, POST on topology change).

Git workflow: Never push directly to dev branch. Never push dev to origin at all. Always create feature/ or fix/ branches for changes. Ask for user permission before pushing to any remote branch or creating PRs.
